articles.title: Stargazers prepare for spectacular Leonids meteor shower: All you need to know about the celestial event - Times Now
articles.description: Every year, debris from a comet known as 55P/Tempel-Tuttle found in the constellation of Leo litters the Earth's atmosphere in November, causing a show of spectacular fireworks in the night sky.
articles.content: • The Leonid meteors have an interesting history. They were originally recognised as meteors all the way back in 1833 following a historic meteor shower that lit up the night sky
